meanings.definition: To give back or restore (money) to someone
meanings.sent1: I am refunding the money to the customer.
meanings.sent2: The store is refunding the purchase price to the dissatisfied customer.
meanings.sent3: The magician mistakenly made the money disappear, but then he magically started refunding it back to the audience.
meanings.sent4: The sun seemed to be refunding the warmth it had taken away during the cold night.
meanings.sent5: The kind neighbor was refunding the borrowed money with a smile.

meanings.sent1: She is refunding the loan she took from the bank.
meanings.sent2: The company is refunding the debt to its creditors.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel promised to refund the acorn it borrowed from the tree.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness was like refunding a debt of gratitude to those who helped her.
meanings.sent5: The rain refunding the parched earth with life-giving water.

meanings.definition: To exchange (an item) for a different one
meanings.sent1: I will be refunding this shirt for a larger size.
meanings.sent2: The customer is refunding the defective product for a new one.
meanings.sent3: The kids were playfully refunding their toys with each other.
meanings.sent4: The clouds seemed to be refunding the dark sky for a brighter day.
meanings.sent5: The caterpillar was refunding its old cocoon for a beautiful butterfly.

meanings.definition: To provide funds for (an organization or project) again
meanings.sent1: The government is refunding the school for its renovation project.
meanings.sent2: The donors are refunding the charity for its upcoming event.
meanings.sent3: The piggy bank was happily refunding the coins for the school fundraiser.
meanings.sent4: Her smile seemed to be refunding the room with positivity.
meanings.sent5: The sun was refunding the garden with its life-giving rays.
